results.name: Product_{k>=1}1/(1 - x^k)^a(k) = 1 + 2x.
comment: Apart from initial terms, exponents in expansion of A065472 as a product zeta(n)^(-a(n)).
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..3000
G. Niklasch, Some number theoretical constants: 1000-digit values [Cached copy]
N. J. A. Sloane, Euler transform
formula: G.f.: Sum_{n>=1} moebius(n)*log(1 + 2*x^n)/n, where moebius(n)=A008683(n). - _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 13 2010
For n == 2 (mod 4), a(n) = -(A001037(n) + A001037(n/2)). - _George Beck_ and _Max Alekseyev_, May 23 2016
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Jan 04 1999
